TITLE: Your cash savings may finally yield a higher return — but only at certain banks
SUMMARY: Ten or so banks have raised yields on savings accounts since mid-April, good news for consumers whose cash has been hammered by inflation.

TITLE: Worried about a recession? Here’s how to prepare your portfolio
SUMMARY: Eight in ten small business owners expect a recession this year, according to a CNBC survey. Here's how to prepare your portfolio.

TITLE: Over 60 million tax returns could be completed automatically, study shows
SUMMARY: The IRS could automate over 60 million tax returns, saving filers time and money, according to a study.

TITLE: The Fed just hiked interest rates and signaled more increases are coming. Here are money moves to make now
SUMMARY: Consumers have a chance to shore up their finances before the Fed increases interest rates again.

TITLE: Workers have been enjoying fatter paychecks. A slowdown may be ahead
SUMMARY: Workers have been enjoying fatter paychecks as demand for their labor has surged to historical levels during the pandemic recovery. That may be changing.

TITLE: This is how student loan debt became a $1.7 trillion crisis
SUMMARY: Every year millions of new students are pumped into the federal loan system while current borrowers struggle to exit it.

TITLE: Democrats are pushing to renew the expanded child tax credit. Here's why that hasn't happened yet
SUMMARY: Democrats have called for re-upping the child tax credit expansion that helped millions of families last year. But that process has not been clear cut.

TITLE: ‘We are being squeezed in every direction’ – As inflation grips small businesses, here’s how they are responding
SUMMARY: Some 75% of small business owners are experiencing a rise in the cost of their supplies, yet only 40% are increasing prices, a CNBC survey found.

TITLE: Here's what Americans plan to spend more money on as inflation pushes prices higher
SUMMARY: Americans plan to spend more on an array of items due to rising inflation, but many are making changes to adjust budgets to higher costs.

TITLE: Stocks are tumbling. Here's what to keep in mind
SUMMARY: Volatile markets can be scary for investors. Here's what financial experts say to keep in mind when stocks whiplash.

TITLE: Employers boost mental wellness benefits amid the Great Resignation
SUMMARY: The Covid-19 pandemic drove home the demand for mental wellness benefits. The Great Resignation is showing the need for companies to follow through.

TITLE: Rising interest rates mean higher loan costs when you go to buy a car. Monthly payments already average $650
SUMMARY: With the Federal Reserve increasing a key interest rate, borrowing costs are poised to head higher on a variety of consumer loans, including those for autos.

TITLE: How small businesses can avoid financial missteps in an inflationary environment
SUMMARY: As inflation hits highs not seen in decades, here's a look at how small business owners can avoid financial flubs that could set them back.

TITLE: Op-ed: Cryptocurrency should be allowed in individual retirement plans. That's why I'm introducing the Financial Freedom Act
SUMMARY: The federal government has no business interfering with the ability of American workers to invest their 401(k) savings as they see fit, says Sen. Tommy Tuberville, R-Ala.

TITLE: As mortgage rates rise, here’s how to decide whether you should buy a home or rent
SUMMARY: Rising mortgage rates and prices are squeezing buyers. At the same time, rents are also up. Here's what to consider when deciding which move is right for you.

TITLE: Secure 2.0 legislation would make retirement catch-up limits more generous for some. Here's who would really benefit
SUMMARY: Individuals approaching retirement may put away more catch-up money, if a proposal becomes law. But the benefits may be limited to high-income workers.

TITLE: Eight attorneys general call on Biden to cancel federal student debt for every borrower
SUMMARY: Eight attorneys general wrote a letter to President Joe Biden on Wednesday, requesting that he forgive federal student debt for every borrower.

TITLE: Here's what the Fed's half-point rate hike means for your money
SUMMARY: The Fed announced its sharpest rate hike since 2000 to fight inflation. Here's how that impacts your credit card, mortgage, car loan, student debt and savings.

TITLE: TurboTax owner Intuit to pay $141 million to customers 'unfairly charged'
SUMMARY: The tax filing software provider will pay restitution to 4.4 million customers who used TurboTax's Free Edition for tax years 2016 through 2018.

TITLE: Education Department forgives loans of more than 110,000 people in public service
SUMMARY: The Education Department has canceled around $6.8 billion in student debt for more than 110,000 borrowers through the public service loan forgiveness waiver.

TITLE: This fund will give money to Asian, elderly and LGBTQ people who need safe rides
SUMMARY: Café Maddy Cab, which reimburses cab fares and gives out free ride vouchers for Asian, elderly and LGBTQ people, will relaunch this month

TITLE: Here’s how much cash retirees need to weather a stock market downturn
SUMMARY: With high inflation and rising interest rates, many worry about a prolonged stock market downturn. Here's how much cash retirees need to prepare.

TITLE: Bill to improve federal benefits for the elderly, blind and disabled may herald broader reform, Sen. Sherrod Brown says
SUMMARY: A bipartisan bill to raise asset limits for SSI beneficiaries could be the first step in updating the outdated federal benefits program, Sen. Sherrod Brown said.

TITLE: The Great Resignation is still red hot — but may not last
SUMMARY: The "Great Resignation" is still red-hot but economic headwinds mean those benefits may not last much longer for workers looking to switch jobs.

TITLE: Here’s where I bonds may work in your portfolio, according to financial advisors
SUMMARY: I bonds are currently paying 9.62% annual interest through October, which is an opportunity for a range of goals, according to financial experts.

TITLE: Relying on stocks for a near-term purchase? What to consider as the market gyrates
SUMMARY: Relying on stocks to fund a near-term expense like a home or college tuition is often a bad idea. The current market leaves people with few good options.

TITLE: How to teach your kids to have a healthy relationship with money – even if you didn't
SUMMARY: "Children need to learn from a very early age that money is not a scary concept," said Debra Kaplan, a licensed therapist, author and speaker.

TITLE: Getting an inheritance or winning the lottery can create serious emotional and financial challenges
SUMMARY: Coming into sudden wealth can create emotional and financial challenges for people who have not had a lot of money in their lives.

TITLE: Op-ed: Money decisions by women will shape the future for the U.S.
SUMMARY: As women begin to control ever more of household assets in the U.S., financial services firms must adapt to find betters ways to meet female clients' needs.

TITLE: Student debt ticks higher as the future of loan forgiveness remains uncertain
SUMMARY: As loan forgiveness remains uncertain, the cost of college keeps going up along with the amount students expect to borrow.
